numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I look at the chart for a student who has no legacy.
2. It looks like colleges try to fix income inequality.
3. This does not hold at the top of the parent-income distribution.
4. A parent-income between 50-percentile and 85-percentile works against the student.
5. The chance of admission without legacy is exceptionally low.
6. I wonder why the legacy boost dips around the 85-percentile.
7. I wonder if donations to colleges increase when parents' income exceeds the 85-percentile.
8. I wonder what the exact numbers of legacy students and non-legacy students are for each parent-income value.
9. Legacy students may be a relatively small number of students.
10. If legacy students are a relatively small number of students then colleges may be justified to give this boost to a few ex-students.
11. Some ex-students donated to their college.
12. Some ex-students helped their college in other ways.
13. The headline is: The Multi-Generational Benefit of an Ivy League Education.
14. This benefit causes stress to break in.
